intro: Aeollanthus bequaertii, commonly known as the Cape fynbos lichen, is a unique plant that thrives in the coastal regions of South Africa. It is a member of the Rhytidophyaceae family and is characterized by its intricate, thalloid structure. This plant is often found growing on rock surfaces, where it forms a symbiotic relationship with algae and fungi. Its botanical significance lies in its role as an indicator species for specific microhabitats. Due to its limited distribution and ecological specificity, it is considered a rare and vulnerable species.
